text: Paul Breitner (born 5 September 1951) is a former German football player. He has played for West Germany national team. ==Career statistics== ===Club career statistics=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League National Cup Europe Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Bayern Munich 1969–70 Bundesliga – 1 0 – 1 0 1970–71 21 2 5 0 4 0 30 2 1971–72 30 4 6 0 8 1 44 5 1972–73 32 4 6 1 5 0 43 5 1973–74 26 7 4 1 7 1 37 9 Total 109 17 22 2 24 2 155 21 Real Madrid 1974–75 La Liga 29 3 6 0 35 3 1975–76 25 6 7 0 32 6 1976–77 30 1 3 0 33 1 Total 84 10 16 0 100 10 Eintracht Braunschweig 1977–78 Bundesliga 30 10 2 0 5 1 37 11 Bayern Munich 1978–79 Bundesliga 33 12 2 1 – 35 13 1979–80 32 10 3 2 10 4 45 16 1980–81 30 17 2 0 8 1 40 18 1981–82 29 18 6 5 7 5 42 28 1982–83 22 9 2 1 6 3 30 13 Total 146 66 15 9 31 13 182 84 Career total 369 103 39 11 76 16 484 130 ===International career statistics=== |- |1971||2||0 |- |1972||7||1 |- |1973||6||0 |- |1974||11||4 |- |1975||2||0 |- |1976||0||0 |- |1977||0||0 |- |1978||0||0 |- |1979||0||0 |- |1980||0||0 |- |1981||8||3 |- |1982||12||2 |- !Total||48||10 |} ==Honours== Bayern Munich * Bundesliga: 1971–72, 1972–73, 1973–74, 1979–80, 1980–81 * DFB-Pokal: 1970–71, 1981–82 * European Cup: 1973–74; runner-up: 1981–82 Real Madrid * La Liga: 1974–75, 1975–76 * Copa del Rey: 1974–75 West Germany * FIFA World Cup: 1974; runner-up: 1982 * UEFA European Championship: 1972 Individual * kicker Bundesliga Team of the Season: 1971–72, 1972–73, 1978–79, 1979–80, 1980–81, 1981–82, 1982–83 *UEFA European Championship Team of the Tournament: 1972 * FIFA World Cup All-Star Team: 1974 *World XI: 1972, 1974, 1975, 1976 * Footballer of the Year (Germany): 1981 * Ballon d'Or runner-up: 1981 * Onze d'Argent: 1981 * FIFA World Cup All-Time Team * FIFA 100 * Bayern Munich All-time XI * Ballon d'Or Dream Team (bronze): 2020 ==References== Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:German footballers Category:Sportspeople from Bavaria
